summary: Use this api to get detail information of a return by return id
description: Use this api to get detail information of a return by return id.

query.name: page_no
query.description: Specifies the starting entry of data to return in the current call. Default is 0. if data is more than one page, the offset can be some entry to start next call.

query.name: page_size
query.description: if many items are available to retrieve, you may need to call GetReturnList multiple times to retrieve all the data. Each result set is returned as a page of entries. Default is 40. Use the Pagination filters to control the maximum number of entries (<= 100) to retrieve per page (i.e., per call), the offset number to start next call. This integer value is usUed to specify the maximum number of entries to return in a single ""page"" of data.

query.name: create_time_from
query.description: The create_time_from and create_time_to fields specify a date range for retrieving orders (based on the order create time). The create_time_from field is the starting date range. The maximum date range that may be specified with the create_time_from and create_time_to fields is 15 days.

query.name: create_time_to
query.description: The create_time_from and create_time_to fields specify a date range for retrieving orders (based on the order create time). The create_time_from field is the starting date range. The maximum date range that may be specified with the create_time_from and create_time_to fields is 15 days.

query.name: update_time_from
query.description: The update_time_from and update_time_to fields specify a date range for retrieving orders (based on the last return updated time). The update_time_from field is the starting date range. The maximum date range that may be specified with the update_time_from and update_time_to fields is 15 days. update_time_from should be >= create_time_from

query.name: update_time_to
query.description: The update_time_from and update_time_to fields specify a date range for retrieving orders (based on the last return updated time). The update_time_from field is the starting date range. The maximum date range that may be specified with the update_time_from and update_time_to fields is 15 days. update_time_from should be >= create_time_from

query.name: status
query.description: This is for filtering return request by return status. See "Data Definition - ReturnStatus"

query.name: negotiation_status
query.description: This is for filtering return request by counter status. See "Data Definition - NegotiationStatus"

query.name: seller_proof_status
query.description: This is for filtering return request by proof status. See "Data Definition - SellerProofStatus"

query.name: seller_compensation_status
query.description: This is for filtering return request by compensation status. See "Data Definition - SellerCompensationStatus"

request_examples.code:
<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, array(
  CURLOPT_URL => 'https://partner.shopeemobile.com/api/v2/returns/get_return_list?access_token=access_token&create_time_from=1655392442&create_time_to=1655392542&negotiation_status=TERMINATED&page_no=1&page_size=10&partner_id=partner_id&seller_compensation_status=NOT_REQUIRED&seller_proof_status=PENDING&shop_id=shop_id&sign=sign&status=REQUESTED&timestamp=timestamp&update_time_from=1655392442&update_time_to=1655392542',
  CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
  CURLOPT_ENCODING => '',
  CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
  CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 0,
  CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION => true,
  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
  CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => 'GET',
  CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => array(
    'Content-Type: application/json'
  ),
));

$response = curl_exec($curl);

curl_close($curl);
echo $response;

schema.name: request_id
schema.description: The identifier for an API request for error tracking

schema.name: error
schema.description: error code

schema.name: message
schema.description: error description

schema.name: response
schema.description: Amount of the refund.

schema.name: more
schema.description: Whether has next page

schema.name: image
schema.description: Image URLs of return.

schema.name: reason
schema.description: Reason for return product. Applicable values: See Data Definition- ReturnReason.

schema.name: text_reason
schema.description: Reason that buyer provide.

schema.name: return_sn
schema.description: The serial number of return.

schema.name: refund_amount
schema.description: Amount of the refund.

schema.name: currency
schema.description: Currency of the return.

schema.name: create_time
schema.description: The time of return create.

schema.name: update_time
schema.description: The time of modify return.

schema.name: status
schema.description: Enumerated type that defines the current status of the return. Applicable values: See Data Definition- ReturnStatus.

schema.name: due_date
schema.description: The last time seller deal with this return.

schema.name: tracking_number
schema.description: The tracking number assigned by the shipping carrier for item shipment.

schema.name: dispute_reason
schema.description: The reason of seller dispute return. While the return has been disputed, this field is useful. Applicable values: See Data Definition- ReturnDisputeReason.

schema.name: dispute_text_reason
schema.description: The reason that seller provide. While the return has been disputed, this field is useful.

schema.name: needs_logistics
schema.description: Items to be sent back to seller. Can be either integrated/non-integrated.

schema.name: amount_before_discount
schema.description: Order price before discount.

schema.name: username
schema.description: Buyer's nickname, will be masked as "****" if it is a non-integrated return in TW region.

schema.name: email
schema.description: Buyer's email, will be empty if it is a non-integrated return in TW region.

schema.name: portrait
schema.description: Buyer's portrait, will be empty if it is a non-integrated return in TW region.

schema.name: model_id
schema.description: Shopee's unique identifier for a variation of an item.

schema.name: name
schema.description: Name of item in local language.

schema.name: images
schema.description: Image URLs of item.

schema.name: amount
schema.description: Amount of this item.

schema.name: item_price
schema.description: The price of item.

schema.name: is_add_on_deal
schema.description: To indicate if this item belongs to an addon deal.

schema.name: is_main_item
schema.description: To indicate if this item is main item or sub item. True means main item, false means sub item.

schema.name: add_on_deal_id
schema.description: The unique identity of an addon deal.

schema.name: item_id
schema.description: The id of item.

schema.name: item_sku
schema.description: The sku of item.

schema.name: variation_sku
schema.description: The variation sku of item

schema.name: order_sn
schema.description: Shopee's unique identifier for an order.

schema.name: return_ship_due_date
schema.description: The due date for buyer to ship order.

schema.name: return_seller_due_date
schema.description: The due date for seller to deal with this return when buyer have shipped order.

schema.name: negotiation_status
schema.description: Counter status. See "Data Definition - NegotiationStatus"

schema.name: seller_proof_status
schema.description: Proof status. See "Data Definition - SellerProofStatus"

schema.name: seller_compensation_status
schema.description: Compensation status. See "Data Definition - SellerCompensationStatus"

schema.name: return_refund_type
schema.description: To indicate whether the return is RRBOC (Return/Refund request raised before Order Complete) or RRAOC (Return/Refund request raised after Order Complete).

schema.name: return_solution
schema.description: To indicate the most updated solution of the Return/Refund request (NOTE: this is not the solution during negotiation). Applicable value: - 0: Return and Refund - 1: Refund Only

error_codes.message: The period between create_time_from and created_time_of must not more than 15 days.
The update_time_from must be after create_time_from.
There is no access_token in query.
There is no partner_id in query.
There is no sign in query.
Query offer info failed. Please try later.
Query order info failed. Please try later.
Query proof info failed. Please try later.
